p: In this study section, we selected a concentration of 10 µL/mL of EO. The C. albicans (10 7 cells) was cultured in the presence of Mentha × piperita EO at 10 µL/mL or its vapor. C. albicans cultured in the absence of EO was the negative control; while the yeast cultured with 5 µg/mL of Amph-B represented the positive control. After a 24 h culture, the cells were fixed in 3% ( v/v) gluteraldehyde in PBS and dehydrated in increasing concentrations of ethanol (10%, v/v, increments to 100%), and subjected to scanning electron microscope analyses [ 36].
